name: How many are smaller than me II?
description: This is a hard version of How many are smaller than me?. If you have troubles solving this one, have a look at the easier kata first. Write ```javascript function smaller(arr) ``` ```rust fn smaller(arr: &[i32]) -> Vec ``` that given an array ```arr```, you have to return the amount of numbers that are smaller than ```arr[i]``` to the right. For example: ```javascript smaller([5, 4, 3, 2, 1]) === [4, 3, 2, 1, 0] smaller([1, 2, 0]) === [1, 1, 0] ``` ```rust smaller(&[5, 4, 3, 2, 1]) == [4, 3, 2, 1, 0]; smaller(&[1, 2, 0]) == [1, 1, 0]; ``` ~~~if:python ### Note Your solution will be tested against inputs with up to 120_000 elements ~~~ ~~~if:rust ### Note Your solution will be tested against inputs with up to 150_000 elements ~~~ ~~~if:javascript ### Note Your solution will be tested against inputs with up to 100_000 elements ~~~
